title: Chocolate Homemade Truffles
description: Slightly updated and enriched recipe of sweets (Adult edition).
story:
Easy to make, no baking, you literally just mix everything and that’s all. Very good with a morning coffee or as a sweet snack for big parties.
Can be enriched with dried berries, such as raisins or cranberries. You also have a total freedom sizing each truffle - I like them in a mini cupcakes liners.

title: Greek Salad
description: Light, easy, healthy, delicious. Very good dinner option to have after a work day.
story:
As in all salads recipes - you can definitely free your imagination with ingredients you put in. This is the set I like most. Lightly fried pecans - what makes this salad taste special to me.

I like making all the bit about the same size - quite big, almost as big as jumbo black olives.

title: Ham & Cheese Crepes
description: Nothing fancy today, just simply delicious and easy to make Crepes.
story:
You can play with stuffing: sweet curd, fried ground beef with onions, chicken with cheese, tomatoes and mozzarella, bananas and Nutella; the list here is endless in fact.

Today I'm making Crepes with ham, cheese and vegetables.

title: Light Asparagus Soup
description: A must try recipe especially when asparagus are in season.
story:
Light, delicious soup, very good for healthy dinner. Once all the ingridients are on a counter - it takes a no time to asseble and heat the soup.

You can add cooked chicken or salmon to this soup, to make it richer. But it is good as is too.
We have great asparagus season in Washington.

title: Mini Cheesecakes
description: This recipe is absolute saver. I bake these cheesecake for every bigger party.
story:
Very easy recipe, everytime comes as expected. Best on the second day after baking.

You can play with topping: jelly, jam, whipped cream, just berries - as well as keep it simple clean. I use cupcakes liners, but if you want - you can pour the mixture strait into small baking molds.

title: Wild rice & Chicken
description: Easy to make after the work for healthy and delicious dinner.
story:
Really fast recipe and you can use almost all the vegetables you have. You can season it with some soy sauce. And of course, you can use salmon or shrimps instead of chicken.

This easy recipe could go as a side dish for fish or meat or can be just good by itself.

title: Pasta Bolognese
description: Very deliciuos as well as filling dinner, can be easily cooked after work.
story:
This is a good recipe to cook for a big family gathering. Bolognese sauce tastes the same after defrosting, so I usually make twice bigger bowl and freeze it for super quick future dinners.

In this photo pasta is seasoned with grated cheddar, although I prefer Parmigiano instead.

title: Cookies
description: Macadamia nuts & Blueberry and Chocolate Chips Cookies.
story:
This is real life saver recipe when it comes to unexpected guests visiting : ) very easy, very fast and usually made from ingredients that are at home all the time. And you may add literally anything you want in your cookies – my favorite Macadamia nuts and blueberries, my husband’s – chocolate chips : ).

Here is how I cook it.

title: Mango Tart
description: A drop of almond extract in a cream - that's what makes it special!
story:
I took a Sweet Pastry Crust recipe from Joy Of Baking site. Everthing else was just an experiment, which came very delicious.

I think any fruits or berries can go on top - I'm using mangos this time.

title: Ultimate Pancakes
description: Best pancakes recipe so far! Takes some time to cook, but worth it.
story:
For a long time I was in search for the best pancakes recipe. In my family we prefer pancakes to be light, flufy and moist inside. So after lots of tries and fails - here it is - so far the best pancakes recipe.

We usually have them with maple syrup and berries. I also like some sour cream on my pancakes.

title: Swedish Pancakes
description: So called Swedish pancakes are worth a try: fluffy, soft, light.
story: I first tryed these in US. Very fluffy, light and absolutely deliciuos pancakes. Usually served with lingonberry jam.

title: Eggs Benedict
description: Ultimate brunch to start a happy Saturday or Sunday.
story:
I like to order eggs Benedict when we have brunch outside home. But actually it's quite easy to do at home as well. The egg usually doesn't look that nice as in restaurant, but the taste is the same (or even better sometimes :)).

This is our way of starting Saturday or Sunday.

title: Veggie pie
description: If you want to impress - this is what you need to bake.
story: This festive dish is absolutely beautiful, good when you really want to impress :). Goes well with baked lamb ribs. We’ve cooked this combination for our cosy new year’s dinner.

title: Thai shrimp stir-fry
description: Light, but full of flavours. Can be easily customizable recipe.
story: This is a very delicious stir-fry, it is especially good with fresh shrimps (or you can use chicken instead). I got this recipe during master class given by Ossama Charafeddine in Vilnius.

title: Spring rolls & Peanutbutter sauce
description: Light, healthy, very convinient to make for a picnic or as snack for a party.
story: I would say it’s both: a healthy and delicious choice. Chicken may be replaced with other cooked meat (e.g. duck, turkey) or with more vegies for vegetarian option.</br></br>Mango maybe substituted with a pineapple or even peach.

title: Feta and watermelon salad
description: You can tell the summer is here. Fresh! Delicious! Unusual!
story: I just love this combination of fresh watermellon, salty feta and roasted nuts. </br></br>This salad became number one for us on a hot summer day. It's just so refreshing!

title: Carrot Muffins
description: Sweet and moist inside with a twist of bitterness from orange jam topping
story: It's rather an autumn desert with warm flavours of cinnamon and nutmeg, but I wanted to share it here now to remember how good it was. </br></br>I think it would be good with pecan nuts and rasins added to the batter, unfortunately I didn't have enough this time.

title: Lasagna
description: This is my absolute favourite dish and it's really easy to make
story: This is the dish I like to make for my guests. It's so good with some red wine. I literraly can not stop eating it. </br></br>It takes some time to prepare, but the steps are all very easy. Definitely not good for those, who is on the diet :). </br></br>It gets even better next day.

title: Seafood risotto
description: It's totally a Friday's dinner. A bit of something special yet quick and easy
story:
I’ve got inspired by Martha’s Stewart Asparagus and Lemon Risotto recipe and decided to cooke a bit changed version of it.

As for the stock in this recipe, I made it out of the skin of salmon I’m using later, added a carrot, onion, garlic and seasoned it with salt and pepper.

title: Pear and blue cheese salad
description: Probably our most favourite salad! Pear and blue cheese..
story: We just love blue cheese and everything that has a blue cheese in it :). I change the salad leaves from time to time, but all other ingredients stay. </br></br>The most taste comes from blue cheese, so it should be the best you can get.

title: Savory Palm Tree Cookies
description: Easy to make perfect for a party! Full of mediterranean flavour.
story: I have cooked these 'Palm tree' or Palmieres cookies for my husband's birthday party this year. They were just perfect. </br></br>Easy to make (if you take premade puff pastry), but very delicious and look good.

title: Beef & Cucumber Salad
description: This is very light, juicy and simply delicious beef salad.
story: I take a flank steak for this and it works just fine: I cut meat in thin long slices against the grain and fry them on the hot pan. Another option I've tried - New York steak: grilled medium to well and then sliced.</br></br>This salad is really juicy and you can make it as hot as you like.

title: Mini Berry and Cream Tarts
description: Beautiful, elegant and melting-in-your-mouth delicious tarts.
story: Lately I was making a lot of these for a holiday season. In different variation: as a tart - for a dinner, as mini tarts for party, just as a casual cake. </br></br>Really easy to make, pastry can be made in advance and frozen. </br></br>The pastry is a real deal here, if you want to avoid cream - just put some peaches or plums on the crust - and I believe it'll be as good.

title: Burrito
description: Number one recipe of a meal 'to-go' for a trip or a picnic.
story: That's what I make when we travel, either by car or plane. Very comfortable to eat outside, delicious even when served cold. Very nourishing yet very moist and juicy. </br></br>A good alternative for a sandwich. </br></br>I make these when we go skiing or hiking or when we travel by plane.

title: Chocolate Peanut butter Brownie
description: Rich chocolate brownie with chocolate chips and peanutbutter swirls.
story: A recipe for true chocolate lovers. This brownie has a really chocolatey flavor with chocolate chunks and peanutbutter. Swirls look impressive. </br></br>Sometimes I replace peanutbutter with almond butter - same deliciousness. </br></br>Very good recipe to go, just cut in smaller pieces and refrigerate before taking to a piknik.

title: Tagliatelle /w Prosciutto and Peas
description: Easy and fast recipe good as a dinner after a work day.
story: This is a very easy recipe (so as probably almost all pasta recipes) with very delicious and rich sauce.</br></br>At first, peas seemed a bit odd to me in this combination, but after trying it - it all makes sense: peas give freshness and color. </br></br>You can make this pasta as rich as you like, if you are on a diet - use less cream and add some water from cooking pasta.

title: Banana cake
description: The most favourite cake of my husband :)
story:
This recipe is from Christina’s Tosi book Momofuku Milk Bar. This is a banana cake they serve at Momofuku, never tried it. Next time we’re in New York – it’s on our list to must visit. This cake became one of the most favorite cakes of my husband. First time I cooked it for 2015 New Years dinner and since then we are having it every (every!) Sunday.

I think the essence of this cake – very very ripe bananas. So we have this routine of ours: every Sunday we buy bananas to make the cake next Sunday. So if I’m making cake on Sunday, then on Friday I’ll put bananas to the freezer till Sunday morning. This is of course optional, but once you defrost bananas – their consistency is the best for such cake.

title: Chicken and Strawbery Salad
description: Simple, fresh summer salad
story:
Quick and simple salad, best when strawberies are in season.

For the salad leaves I usualy take butter letuce and mix it with some baby spinach and arugula.

Sometimes (when I have it in my fridge) I like to add some philadelfia or similar cheese to this salad. But even without cheese, it's great.

title: Buttermilk Pancakes
description: Perfect for long weekend brunch.
story:
I have several pancakes recipes that I like, the recint one - buttermilk pancakes.

Perfect with some sourcream and hot chocolate drink, or with fresh berries and maple syrup.

title: Panna Cotta
description: Easy to make yet heavenly delicious
story:
I still can not believe how easy it is to make Panna Cotta.

Most instructions call to heat cream and milk, I have a slightly different technique which makes Panna Cotta light and fluffy

title: Quinoa Kale Goat Cheese Salad
description: Quick salad, good warm or cold
story: Delicious and interesting salad, which you can make quite quickly. May be served warm, but is very good cold as well.</br></br>I like it with some goat cheese, but cheese may be skipped if you are not a fan.</br></br>Most of the cooking time is taken by preparing quinoa and it definitely can be done in advance.

title: Cheesecake
description: A perfect cheesecake, sweet and rich just enough
story:
After baking cheesecake for many many times, this is the recipe I like the most.

I adjusted the richeness to my taste as well as sweetenes. Worth spending extra time on proper baking and cooling, since it makes the cheescake creamy and without cracks on top.

title: Cottage Cheese Doughnuts
description: Very easy to make, yealds 36 one bite doughnuts
story:
This is a recipe from my childhood, I loved these doughnuts when I was a child. I always thought that they are rather hard to make and require a lot of time and oil :). Turns out it is not true. It took me around 30 minutes to make the doughnuts and about half a liter (or a little bit less) of canola oil - the trick is to use small saucepan.

Tip for the next time: make them smaller, aim for 40 or even more out of this amount of ingredients, they would cook faster.

title: Chicken Kiev
description: Look back into Soviet Union times
story:
This is another recipe from my childhood. Now it is my husband's one of the most favorite dishes. I usually make more and freeze.

My personal improvement to the classic recipe - pesto. Before adding butter I just spread some homemade pesto onto the chicken. I serve it with mashed potatoes (half regular and half sweet) and grated carrots with dried prunes and walnuts

title: Potatoe Pancakes
description: Traditional Lithuanian dish
story: Easy to make, very good when served with cottage cheese and smoked salmon or with a dollop of sour cream

title: Belgian Waffles
description: Very good for breakfast
story:
Good for breakfast, but also very good as a sandwitch base. I use leftover waffles, spread some mayo on them, add ham, avocado, cheese and you get perfect open-faced sandwitch.

Usually I make batter night before.

title: Poppy Seed Cake
description: Very sweet coffee treat
story:
This is a modified version of this recipe https://www.beatosvirtuve.lt/receptai/aguonu-pyragas-tortas/

Requires some preparation in advance, may be done a couple of days before serving.
